channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2025010420
item.description:
Report X-2025010420

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor at 281 called Safety to report that a trailer arrived from 034 to 281 with a spill on it. The forklift operator that was about to unload the trailer advised that there was some cardboard covering a pallet of bags and when he moved the cardboard he discovered that at least one o f the bags was torn open and there was white powder all over. The operations supervisor advised that it looked like the bag was torn previously and someone had attempted to tape it over and cover it up. ~~Called CURA and spoke with Lizzie and advised we will need the crew to attempt to determine the cause of the damage.~~Lizzie with CURA advised that the crew discovered two damaged 50 lb bags of UN3262 which released 3 lbs of powder to the trailer floor due to a forklift strike.

item.title: Report X-2025010062
item.description:
Report X-2025010062

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE TAN BELT. RESPONDER PLACED PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO THE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
